ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class was very interesting, and the books we read were very enjoyable and diverse. It is a great opportunity to have a lot of discussion.

Spanish 750 will expose you to a variety of Spanish novels published between Franco's death in 1975 and 1995. In addition to analyzing the literary texts, you will read and discuss texts that address pertinent theory and critical approaches, and you will also study the social and historical context.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class really helped me understand how to develop a critical stance in my papers, not just a few observations.

I am interested in contemporary Latin American literature, so analyzing Peninsular literature from roughly the same time period enriches my perspective and allows me to create parallels and make comparisons. Also, several of the novels we read are on the list for our comprehensive exams.
